course_title: Fresh Sem: Physics: Collective BehaviorLiving Sys.
class_notes:
Topic: Collective behavior in living systems: the physics of animal groups


From flocks of birds and schools of fish to swarms of insects and colonies of ants, the behaviors exhibited by groups of animals can be far richer and more complex than that of individual animals on their own.  We will discuss the wide range of behaviors observed in a diversity of living systems as well as the experimental, theoretical, and modeling approaches that provide insight into the underlying physics of animal interactions.
course_description: Freshman seminar, for first year students only. Variable topics.
